channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Major pothole in section that you can’t avoid, 2nd January
item.description:
Major pothole in thin section of road where the crossing is so can’t be avoided due to the width of the road being small
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albert Bridge, Chelsea, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous black ice covering these roads, 2nd January
item.description:
The black ice along Bournewood Road, Kynaston Road, and Northfield Avenue is a dangerous risk to drivers and pedestrians. Issue needs to be fixed as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bournewood Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vinyl banner affixed to Council pelican crossing pedestrian guard railings fronting Beckenham Library, 22, Beckenham Rd, Beckenham., 2nd January
item.description:
Vinyl banner affixed to Council pelican crossing pedestrian guard railings fronting Beckenham Library, 22, Beckenham Rd, Beckenham. Seen from moving vehicle so no photo. It is about 2m x 0.75m in purple and white and had 'My' in the title like Bromley Mytime for the Beckenham Spa nearby. Bromley Council does not allow advertisements on pedestrian railings and this railing has nothing to do with Mytine Active and the Beckenham Spa. Flyposting is a criminal offence. The Visirail guard railings used here have staggered uprights so that children can see and be seen through the railings. A plastic barrier negates this safety feature too
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Beckenham Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins so overfull impossible to access, 2nd January
item.description:
The bins haven't been emptied since before Christmas. There's a mountain of rubbish. Please remove it urgently. The bins have narrow slots to put things in but the estate uses green recycle sacks. So we can't get them inside.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Broke Walk, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Fly tipping, 2nd January
item.description:
Children’s pram has been abandoned. Also across the road and to the side of Batwa House (on the bend of Varcoe Road) there is furniture that has been fly tipped. The pram has been here since approx. 29th December . The furniture (dressing table, mirror) has been there since 30th. There is also a children’s potty opposite the abandoned dressing table.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Varcoe Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gritting required, 2nd January

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Versailles Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London

item.title: Grit box needs filling, 2nd January
item.description:
The grit box is empty and has not been filled for years. We would like to request this is filled so then we can grit the public roads to prevent them from being icy and dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Batchwood Green, St Paul's Cray, Greater London

item.title: Huge pothole in middle lane, 2nd January
item.description:
Pothole between elevated roundabout and Boiler house roundabout. Middle lane, half way along road. It is huge and vehicles are having to swerve into adjacent lane to avoid. Particularly dangerous at night when it is dark,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Carlyle Road, Thamesmead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
